#: raffadub changed the world a bit at a time by saying on  8/22/2005 10:09 PM :#
> Assuming there is a test function with several assertions; if one
> failes the assertions past it are not executed. Is there a way to get
> around this issue? More specifically; is it possible to execute all
> assertions in a test function despite some have failed.
> 
> I attempted using JFunc, but it is slightly incomplete. Other than
> this extension, I have had little luck finding anything else.
> 
> Cheers!
> -Raffie-

A long time ago, put in almost the same situation (having multiple assertions with different results 
on same test) I have patched the Assert class behavior in the following way:
- first things in the test method you set the behavior of the assertion (fail on assert, continue on 
failed assertion, defaulting to JUnit general behavior)
- with the 2nd type of behavior having all the failures reported at the end of the method

The only thing I have missed at that point was that the total numbers where screwed :-).

I will not dive into the discussion if this was bad or good, cause I cannot remember the whole 
thing. All I remember is what I have done :-).

take care,
